definitions.text: the act of counting; reciting numbers in ascending order
examples: the counting continued for several hours

definitions.text: a nobleman (in various countries) having rank equal to a British earl
determine the number or amount of
examples: Can you count the books on your shelf?

definitions.text: have weight; have import, carry weight
show consideration for; take into account
examples: The judge considered the offender's youth and was lenient

definitions.text: name or recite the numbers in ascending order

examples: The academy counts several Nobel Prize winners among its members
I can count my colleagues in the opposition

definitions.text: have a certain value or carry a certain weight
examples: each answer counts as three points
you can count on me to help you any time
Look to your friends for support
Depend on your family in times of crisis
You have to reckon with our opponents
